ovdesc.p: Holds the definition of the product and the user can input the SY.EVENT(s) that can occur during that products lifecycle and the operations on SY.UNIT(s) that should be performed when that event is processed.

desc.p: This field holds a generic category id which degfines the category of the product. This information is defaulted from the SY.PARAMETER record.
This is a list of Events that can occur in the product lifecycle.
All Activities (An Activity = Operation + Unit + optionally Instance ) under a single event will occur in a single transaction bound.
Can contain valid SY.EVENT.DEFINITION keys.
This field sets the default value for inclusion/exclusion of SY underlying deals in the valuation and customer position reporting.
If set to "YES" this will only report the SY deal otherwise all transactions created by the SY product along with the SY deal will be displayed.
The first date on which a deal for this product may be accepted into the system.
The last date on which a deal for this product may be accepted into the system.
Description of the product

This field can be used to specify any delivery message(s) to be invoked for this event.

When Tracking is set to 'YES' the instantiated Products will track any changes made to this Product Definition during the product lifecycle.
Otherwise the instantiated Products will copy the state of the Product definition when created.

Can be YES or NO (or blank if TRACKING is set to YES)

This specifies whether this event is active or not.
An attempt to process an Event that is not active will raise an error.
Must be either YES or NO.
When 'YES' this indicates that the Product is completed and can be dealt on.
Deals cannot be created for a Product which is not complete.
This is a list of Dependent Events that must have occurred previously in this product's lifecycle in order for this event to occur.
Attempting to process an Event that has not had all its dependencies satisfied will raise an error.
Can contain valid SY.EVENT.DEFINITION.RECORDS.
When yes this indicates that a deposit is required.
This field defaults from the value of DEPOSIT in the SY.PARAMETER record
Must be either YES or NO.
For Scheduled and/or rolling events the Close of business processing will be invoked. This field indicates the COB stage in which the associated event will be processed.
The value in this field will be defaulted to corresponding event in SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT, which will in turn be defaulted in respective SY.EVENT record.
If set to 'Close of Business', event will be processed before system date change.
If set to 'Start of Day', event will be processed after system date change.
If set to 'Online', event will be processed after system date change during ONLINE phase.

Allowed values are YES and NO. When set to YES the underlying transactions are not created by the system i.e. The product lifecycle is managed by an external system which would interface underlying transactions to T24.
All subsequent updates to the underlying transactions is also updated by the external system (or by manual input).
When set to NO the underlying transactions are not suppressed and is created from the structured product contract. The lifecycle events of the product is processed by T24.

The value in this field will be defaulted to SUPRESS.UNDERLYING field of SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT record. If the SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT is not available then the value will be defaulted in the respective contract.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
This field will accept a valid T24 routine which will be called during the fixing event. This field can have a value only if SUPRESS.UNDERLYING is set to 'NO'.
The routine will have 2 arguments, first one will be an incoming argument in which CONTRACT ID will be passed while second one will be an outgoing argument in which accrued nominal will be returned.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
If this field is set to YES, and the contract gets knocked out within the MIN.ACCRUAL.PERIOID, then the contract is terminated immediately and guaranteed units of shares will be settled.

If this field is null or set to NO and the contract gets knocked out within the MIN.ACCRUAL.PERIOD, then accrual would continue up to the PROTECTED.DATE and the guaranteed units of shares will be settled at that point of time.

The value in this field will be defaulted to MIN.PERIOD.KOUT field of SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT record. If the SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT is not available then the value will be defaulted in the respective contract.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
YES - Contract will be knocked out immediately irrespective of protected date.
NO - Accrual will continue until the protected date and knockout will happen on protected date.

p.p: When set to YES alone Mark-to-Market (MTM) entry is posted for this particular product.

The allowed values are ADJUST and REBOOK. When set to ADJUST the difference between pevious day and todays MTM amount is posted as entry. Whereas when set to REBOOK the previously posted MTM is reversed and the new MTM amount is posted.
MTM unrealised profit and loss pertaining to banks ownbook will be posted to this category.
Balance sheet entry for the MTM will be posted to this internal category (10000 to 19999) if given. If the category is not specified then SPEC entry (CRF TYPES - SYMTMCR and SYMTMDR) will be raised.

This field needs to be set to 'Yes' for those structures, where the contract terms changes as a result of a corporate action on the underlying security. Only applicable to products with security underlying.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.

This field will accept any field name from the underlying contract. These are the fields (terms of the contract) which will undergo a change, when the underlying security undergoes a corporate action.

For Example STRIKE.PRICE would be one of the fields which would be affected when the underlying security undergoes a corporate action. This field can be multivalued to include all possible term sheet elements.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
Validation Rules:
Mandatory if CA.IMPACT is set to 'YES'.
This field will indicate whether the field given in APPICABLE.ELEMENT is a value type field or ratio type field.

Value type fields are those fields which need not be prorated, when the value for the client deal is derived from the back to back deal. For example, STRIKE.PRICE need not be prorated as the same strike price will be recorded in the client deal and back to back deal. if this field changes in the back to back deal, the same value can be updated in the client deal.

Ratio type fields are those fields which needs to be prorated when derived from the back to back deal. DAILY.UNITS for example would be a prorated fields. If there are 10 client deals covered by one back to back deal, DAILY.UNITS field will be different in the back to back deal and the client deal. When the value in the back to back deal changes, the change needs to be prorated on the client deals.ld.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
Validation Rules:
Mandatory if CA.IMPACT is set to 'YES'.
This field can be used to switch on and switch off Notional entries.
If set to 'Yes', notional entries (- contingent entries) would be generated for the structure product contract.
If set to 'No', notional entries would not be generated. Default value would be YES.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
This field will say whether the notional entries should be rebooked or adjusted during the fixing event.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
Allowed values -
'REBOOK' - Previous notional entry is reversed and notional rebooked for the new amount
'ADJUST' - Adjustment entry is posted to reflect the new notional amount.
No input field. Reserved for system use.
Accrual of shares can be suspended for an accumulator/decumulator contract due to an corporate action or due to undeclared stock exchange holiday. This field controls the accrual for suspended days.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
Allowed values -
'YES' - when the suspension is reset, accrual would be carried out for the suspended days using the latest availlable price.
'NO' - accrual would resume from the reset date, units for the suspended days are not recovered.
This field determines the accrual basis for equity accumulator/decumulator contracts.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
Allowed values -
'First' - Accrual on value date , no accrual on the final fixing or maturity date. Accrual for interim fixing date added to next fixing.
'Last' - No accrual on value date, accrual on the final fixing date. Accrual for the interim fixing date added to the current fixing.
'Both' - Accrual on value date and the final fixing date. Accrual for the interim fixing date added to the current fixing.
